intro: Rhododendron scopulum, commonly known as the rock rhododendron, is a deciduous shrub native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of showy, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or well-drained soils, preferring acidic conditions. Its leaves are dark green and leathery, providing a striking contrast to the vibrant flower colors. Rhododendron scopulum is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in challenging environments.
